description: UniFi Poller v2.0.1 Displays detailed information for clients in a UniFi network.

targets.query: SELECT last("ip") AS "Address", last("note") AS "Note", last("network") AS "Network" FROM "clients" WHERE ("is_wired" = 'false' AND "ap_mac" =~ /^$AP$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "mac", "oui", "channel", "radio", "name", "ap_mac"

SELECT last("ip") AS "Address", last("note") AS "Note", last("network") AS "Network" FROM "clients" WHERE ("is_wired" != 'false' AND "name" =~ /^$Client$/ AND "site_name" =~ /$Site$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "sw_port", "mac", "oui", "use_fixedip", "name"

panels.description: Visualize wireless channel usage w/ wired client counts.

targets.query: select count(distinct(hostname)) FROM "clients" WHERE time > now() - 5m AND ("site_name" =~ /$Site$/ AND "name" =~ /^$Wired$/ AND sw_name =~ /$Switch$/ ) GROUP BY "hostname"
select count(distinct(hostname)) FROM "clients" WHERE time > now() - 5m AND ("site_name" =~ /$Site$/ AND "name" =~ /^$Wireless$/ AND ap_name =~ /$AP$/ ) GROUP BY "channel"

panels.title: Clients / Channel

panels.description: Visualize how many clients are connected to which radios/APs.

targets.query: SELECT count(distinct("hostname")) FROM "clients" WHERE  $timeFilter  AND "ap_name" =~ /$AP$/ AND "site_name" =~ /$Site$/  AND "name" =~ /^$Wireless$/ GROUP BY radio_proto

panels.title: Clients / AP Radio

panels.description: This shows an OUI breakdown from Unifi's perspective. e = wired, w = wireless

targets.query: select count(distinct(hostname)) FROM "clients" WHERE time > now() - 5m AND site_name =~ /$Site$/ AND (("name" =~ /^$Wireless$/ AND "ap_name" =~ /^$AP$/) OR ("name" =~ /^$Wired$/ AND "sw_name" =~ /$Switch$/ )) GROUP BY "oui"

panels.title: Client MAC OUI Breakdown

panels.description: No real idea what these numbers are, but Unifi provides them, so I made a cool pie chart out of them. What's your pie chart look like?

targets.query: select count(distinct(hostname)) FROM "clients" WHERE time > now() - 5m AND site_name =~ /$Site$/ AND (("name" =~ /^$Wireless$/ AND "ap_name" =~ /^$AP$/) OR ("name" =~ /^$Wired$/ AND "sw_name" =~ /$Switch$/ )) GROUP BY "os_class", "os_name", "dev_cat", "dev_family", "dev_id"

panels.title: OS/Dev Class/ID Breakdown

panels.description: Wired TX / RX bytes per second (calculated in 30 second buckets). Rx is on the negative axis. Does not include amazon and camera devices. Unaffected by the AP setting.

targets.query: SELECT derivative(sum("wired-rx_bytes"), 1s) AS "Rx", derivative(sum("wired-tx_bytes"), 1s) AS "Tx" FROM "clients" WHERE ("name" !~ /^amazon-|camera|cam$/ AND "name" =~ /^$Wired$/ AND "site_name" =~ /^$Site$/ AND "sw_name" =~ /^$Switch$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval),"name","mac"fill(none)

panels.title: Switch Bandwidth / Wired Devices

panels.description: Bandwidth usage per wireless devices as reported by the UAPs. Rx is on the negative axis. Does not include amazon devices.

targets.query: SELECT derivative(first("wired-rx_bytes"), 1s) FROM "clients" WHERE ("hostname" = 'dns-rtn') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(none)

panels.title: UAP Bandwidth / Wireless Devices

panels.description: Shows which wireless radio a client is connected to. Setting AP does not change this.
panels.title: Wifi Client / AP

panels.description: Shows IPs assigned to non-static clients. Clients with many changes may indicate misconfiguration or two clients sharing the same name.

targets.query: SELECT "ip" FROM "clients" WHERE "use_fixedip" != 'true' AND "name" =~ /^$Client$/ AND ("ap_name" =~ /^$AP$/ OR "sw_name" =~ /$Switch$/) AND "site_name" =~ /^$Site$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "name"
SELECT "ip" FROM "clients" WHERE "use_fixedip" != 'true' AND "name" =~ /^$Client$/ AND ("ap_name" =~ /^$AP$/ OR "sw_name" =~ /$Switch$/) AND "site_name" =~ /^$Site$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "name"

panels.title: Client / IP

panels.description: Amazon Devices TX / RX bytes per second (calculated in 30 second buckets). Rx is on the native axis. My home network has a ton of Amazon devices, so I broke them out separately. If you don't have Amazon devices, don't fret, just don't include this graph in the new dashboards you're building. :)

targets.query: SELECT derivative(first("wired-rx_bytes"), 1s) FROM "clients" WHERE ("hostname" = 'dns-rtn') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(none)
SELECT derivative(first("wired-rx_bytes"), 1s) FROM "clients" WHERE ("hostname" = 'dns-rtn') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(none)

panels.title: Switch Bandwidth / Echos & FireTVs

panels.description: Cameras TX / RX bytes per second. Rx is on the negative axis. Cameras probably don't do much Tx. If you don't have cameras, don't include this graph on your dashboards. This graph shows any device with the word "camera" in its name and has nothing to do with UniFi Protect.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(sum("wired-rx_bytes"), 1s) AS "Rx", non_negative_derivative(sum("wired-tx_bytes"), 1s) AS "Tx" FROM "clients" WHERE "name" =~ /camera|cam$/ AND "site_name" =~ /^$Site$/ AND ("sw_name" =~ /^$Switch$/ OR "ap_name" =~ /^$AP$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "name", "mac"

panels.title: Switch Bandwidth / Cameras

targets.query: SELECT derivative(first("wired-rx_bytes"), 1s) FROM "clients" WHERE ("hostname" = 'dns-rtn') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(none)
SELECT derivative(first("wired-rx_bytes"), 1s) FROM "clients" WHERE ("hostname" = 'dns-rtn') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(none)
SELECT derivative(first("wired-rx_bytes"), 1s) FROM "clients" WHERE ("hostname" = 'dns-rtn') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(none)
SELECT derivative(first("wired-rx_bytes"), 1s) FROM "clients" WHERE ("hostname" = 'dns-rtn') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(none)
SELECT derivative(first("wired-rx_bytes"), 1s) FROM "clients" WHERE ("hostname" = 'dns-rtn') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(none)
SELECT derivative(first("wired-rx_bytes"), 1s) FROM "clients" WHERE ("hostname" = 'dns-rtn') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(none)
SELECT derivative(first("wired-rx_bytes"), 1s) FROM "clients" WHERE ("hostname" = 'dns-rtn') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(none)
SELECT derivative(first("wired-rx_bytes"), 1s) FROM "clients" WHERE ("hostname" = 'dns-rtn') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(none)
SELECT derivative(first("wired-rx_bytes"), 1s) FROM "clients" WHERE ("hostname" = 'dns-rtn') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(none)
SELECT derivative(first("wired-rx_bytes"), 1s) FROM "clients" WHERE ("hostname" = 'dns-rtn') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(none)
SELECT derivative(first("wired-rx_bytes"), 1s) FROM "clients" WHERE ("hostname" = 'dns-rtn') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(none)
SELECT derivative(first("wired-rx_bytes"), 1s) FROM "clients" WHERE ("hostname" = 'dns-rtn') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(none)

list.definition: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "clients" WITH KEY = "source"
list.name: Controller
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "clients" WITH KEY = "source"

list.definition: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "clients" WITH KEY = "site_name"  WHERE source =~ /^$Controller$/
list.name: Site
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "clients" WITH KEY = "site_name"  WHERE source =~ /^$Controller$/

list.definition: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "clients" WITH KEY = "ap_name" WHERE site_name =~ /^$Site$/
list.name: AP
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "clients" WITH KEY = "ap_name" WHERE site_name =~ /^$Site$/

list.definition: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "clients" WITH KEY = "sw_name" WHERE site_name =~ /^$Site$/
list.name: Switch
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "clients" WITH KEY = "sw_name" WHERE site_name =~ /^$Site$/

list.definition: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "clients" WITH KEY = "name" WHERE site_name =~ /^$Site$/ AND ap_name =~ /^$AP$/ AND is_wired=false
list.name: Wireless
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "clients" WITH KEY = "name" WHERE site_name =~ /^$Site$/ AND ap_name =~ /^$AP$/ AND is_wired=false

list.definition: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "clients" WITH KEY = "name" WHERE site_name =~ /^$Site$/ AND sw_name =~ /^$Switch$/ AND is_wired=true
list.name: Wired
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "clients" WITH KEY = "name" WHERE site_name =~ /^$Site$/ AND sw_name =~ /^$Switch$/ AND is_wired=true

title: UniFi-Poller: Client Insights - InfluxDB
